message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.SE 

The paper deals with termination analysis of logic programs, which is a topic that falls under the subfield of logic programming. The use of general orderings is a novel approach to this problem, which suggests that the paper may be relevant to the subfield of logic and computation (cs.LO). Additionally, the paper discusses acceptability and constraint-based verification, which are topics that are commonly associated with programming languages and compilers (cs.PL) and computational logic (cs.CL). The paper also mentions LD-termination, which is a concept from artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper discusses the advantages of the proposed approach over standard acceptability and transformational approaches, which suggests that it may be relevant to software engineering (cs.SE).
